hopobject.name: Page
hopobject.body: What sort of work do you do? arginmax malaysia Since we just finished our discourse on the new features in Android 4.3, we'd be remiss not to discuss the camera app. As usual you'll find the virtual shutter button and camera mode toggle switch (this is where you can change into panorama, video or photo sphere mode), though a dedicated settings key sits above both of these. Pressing this (or long-pressing the viewfinder) brings up a few options displayed in the form of icons above a small arc. It gives you the opportunity to switch to the front-facing camera, tweak exposure or go into more settings, not that there are many. You have white balance, scene modes (night, action, sunset and party), timer and picture size at your disposal, but no HDR, ISO, shutter speed or any other type of adjustment. It's probably for the best anyway, since most images taken with a tablet camera will likely just wind up on Facebook, if you share them at all.
